caption: While a bit pricey - this was one of the best egg sandwiches I've had in my life. The coffee was also yum!
Best spot in all of Brooklyn!

Ciao, Gloria has become my go-to cafe since it opened last year because it never fails to impress! I've been for breakfast (don't miss the BEC / PEC - my new favorite NYC breakfast sandwich...frittata instead of fried eggs? Genius!), lunch (the disco club is a party and a half), and of course I've indulged in some of the many sweet treats that are must-haves (TriColors!!! Need I say more???) I even ordered an Aperol Spritz cake for a birthday that was citrusy-bubbly-celebratory perfection. The seasonal menu always features fun new things to try, and the ambiance (inside as well as outside, now that they have outdoor seating) is peaceful, welcoming, and comfortable, especially thanks to the stellar service. It's my "local" even though I don't live in the neighborhood anymore - but it's well-worth the trip!
Everything is SO good! Try the rainbow cakes and limoncello bars! Yum! Great atmosphere and wonderful service
Terrible coffee and terrible service
Great service in great location

The best cafe around. Fantastic coffee, delicious pastries, innovative breakfast options (the egg sandwich with avocado is arguably one of the best breakfast sammys in NYC). Service is counter service to order, delivered to table- lovely staff. Decor is subtle and welcoming, music is low and calm. Great spot for a date, catch up with a friend or business meetings. Covid 19 standards are present and thorough. Great outdoor setup for warmer weather. This is my new breakfast go to!!!
Good service, nice selection of baked goods
Not only excellent coffee and lattes, but great food and atmosphere as well.

Fantastic cafe. The coffee is delicious. The baked goods are fabulous. The breakfast sandwiches are amazing. And today I just tried a couple of their lunch items which were equally excellent. Friendly, efficient staff, too. A++ quality all at reasonable prices.
Excellent matcha and service!
This place is a dream!! Best BEC (bacon, egg, and cheese) in Brooklyn, don't @ me!! Not to mention amazing sweets, treats, and drinks galore!
This place is SO good. Everything they do, they execute all the way to the end. Coffee, sweet treats, savory bites. Its all good. Definitely try Ciao, Gloria, you will not regret it.

First I came for the sandwiches with fresh focaccia (Fo'Cotto), it was  fantastic , then I came back and had a salad, Insalata Mista ( beets two ways, celery root, crunchy nuts, and an amazing  salad dressing but this time also purchased a slice of apple cake, truly a great cake. I returned again and had one of their divine egg sandwiches with bacon (BEC)and tested out the lemon bar for my evening dessert, the best I have had in Brooklyn. I planning my return to this mellow and friendly breakfast/lunch spot.

Pleasant and calming place. Very nice and kind staff and the atmosphere is soothing. Coffee is great, many options for hot and cold, pastries are delicious (and huge) and the savory ricotta toast was something! (Hand made ricotta that was super fluffy and creamy). Nice place! Highly recommend.
Very good food coffee and pastries!

I never write reviews but this place is absolutely amazing.  It is the best breakfast sandwich I've ever had.  It arrives completely fresh and I can't rave about it enough.  I have been ordering once a week since a discovered this place!
The best cinnamon rolls ever!

**Ordered takeout during COVID pandemic  Food *Italian Disco Club (Turkey breast, prosciutto, avocado, tomato compote, provolone, arugula, and Calabrese aioli on focaccia bread) - good; the aioli gave it a nice kick *Chocolate chip brownie - good

I live around the corner from Ciao Gloria and I’m obsessed with them. EVERYTHING is exceptionally good. They put their own spin on the items they serve and I’ve never been anything less than pleased with my order. The location is cute, the staff is friendly, the coffee is delicious. They’ve ruined me for any other breakfast or lunch spot in the area. Get the Disco Club and thank me later.
1000 stars. Delicious food (both the sweet and savory options), friendly staff, great service. You can't go wrong here.

Airy space, friendly staff and tempting pastries. The pistachio croissant really impressed me. Flaky outside, buttery and airy layers inside. The highlight is definitely the pistachio cream filling, not heavy but with right sweetness. Wish they could have more ceramic coffee cups so that there is no paper cup if ordering coffee to stay. Those ceramics are really cute. Can’t wait to go back to try the savory items on the breakfast/lunch menu.  08.01.2020 Thrilled to see Ciao, Gloria reopen! Finally tried the banana bread. It’s a very thick slice with the perfect moisture in and out. I will love it more if there is no cinnamon on top. Glad the cinnamon that slice was just subtle. I do missed their clay cup though.  08.30.2020 Spiced brown butter fig torte, a seasonal torte. It is very figgy, buttery and moisture. I love figs and of course didn’t miss it. Wish it will be on the menu for a while.

Love the coffee, pastries, and sandwich options here! The breakfast sandwich is my favorite but they also have a ton of vegan items like their muffin, which is always delightful!  Also, they were extremely kind to make me a cake for my brother’s birthday last minute! They followed up on my voicemail and went out of their way to get it done — thank you Ciao!!!

I'm absolutely in love with this place. Give them all your money. They opened just before the pandemic and we need another good brunch/cafe in the neighborhood to survive the storm! Can't wait to go back :)
Love this stylish, friendly place! Excellent baked goods, coffee, and they even host special food nights.
Fantastic and friendly service with a wide variety of pastries, coffee, espresso, and warm options.  A delightful respite on Vanderbilt that's cozy and streamlined all at once.
Very good tricilor spumoni tricolor
Phenomenal breakfast sandwiches
Italian Disco Club is one of the greatest sandwiches you’ll have the opportunity to eat in NYC.

Ciao, Ciao Gloria! We are so happy you’ve reopened today!  We had your grain bowl and it was the best grain bowl I’ve ever had. Thank you for continuing to produce delicious, sweet and savoury food for us during these difficult times! That marinated chicken breast was out of this world...wondering if you can share the recipe? hehe 🤔😋  We are here to support you! 😷

Cute interior and food sounded good when we ordered it but the egg sandwiches come with a McDonalds looking square egg patty, that even if it's fresh, which it doesn't seem to be, doesn't have any spices or flavoring in it. Baked goods and drinks looked good but the sammie was disappointing, especially given the high price tag.

As Tina Turner once said, simply the best. Seriously. I could wax rhapsodic about the pastries (esp the grapefruit morning bun) but absolutely everything is rock solid here: coffee, pastries, and savories. You've gotta try the salty ricotta toast, made extra perfect with the drizzle of chile oil. The place is bright, sunny ,warm. I want to come here every day, but I'll settle for every weekend.
Their baking is fantastic, really like the eggs in purgatory!!
Quaint little coffee shop with swanky interiors.
The pastries are on the sweeter side. Great coffee that goes well with banana bread:)
You have to try the morning buns!

Such a cute and peaceful place with great food.  Came in today to veg and had a really tasty tomato lentil soup.  It was accompanied with a delicious slice of focaccia. It’s bright and airy and quiet with a nice quiet relaxing music soundtrack.    I’m coming back!
Good little modern cafe. Nice breakfast and lunch sandwiches. Also dencent vegetarian options.
This place is great, bright space, delicious food and pretty good coffee. Awesome addition to the neighborhood.
bad coffee
Fast causal spot with some an amazing breakfast sandwich. You gotta get it!
The Chocolate Pecan pie is beyond amazing. Go there. And get it.
Highly recommend the prosciutto egg and cheese or any of the pastries

Fabulous cafe by one of the former founders of Baked (in Red Hook). Renato pays homage to her nonna serving up popular baked goods and sandwiches with an Italian twist. The menu is also subject to evolve as new items are added over time. The interior is cozy and contemporary with abundant natural light along the east facade, and multiple splashes of colors accented in the furniture and space.
Any cafe that serves Verve is good in my book. In a neighborhood chock-full of coffee shops, this is the one not worth missing.

This place is INCREDIBLE. We've tried almost all the desserts and baked goods at this point and each and every one of them is maybe the best I’ve had of it’s kind (brownie, lemon bar, carrot cake, amaretti cookie, even the apple cranberry pie is the best pie I’ve ever had). Loved the mortadella sandwich, too. Can’t wait to try more savory items. GREAT addition to the neighborhood. Great service, coffee bar, free water and plenty of space to sit and relax. Can’t say enough good things about this place. Home run.
Bright and cozy spot with amazing food and good taste of music.

This place is AWESOME!!  I went in the first time thinking this was going to be just another plain cafe.  WRONG!Not only is the coffee great, the food is fantastic and every single member of the staff is competent and incredibly sweet.  It is a pleasure to come here.  Sooooo happy they opened!
Great spot - so happy to have it in the neighborhood. Bright and pleasant space with great food and pastries. Super friendly staff.
Great new spot on Vanderbilt! Food and pastries were excellent. Very bright and welcoming interior. Can’t wait to come back!

Cute cafe with tasty bites. Get the PEC (prosciutto, egg, and cheese) if you want a savory breakfast sandwich. The dessert choices are great too with treats like soft amaretti, pumpkin cinnamon rolls, and "Morning Gloria" cookies. The drip coffee and espresso bar options are all excellent as well
Bright and welcoming space! Quality coffee and the bread used for the avocado toast was some of the most delicious I've had.  Worth checking out.
Amazing addition to the neighborhood!
